title: Probability bounds for $n$ random events under $(n-1)$-wise independence. (arXiv:2211.01596v1 [math.PR])
description: A collection of $n$ random events is said to be $(n - 1)$-wise independent if any $n - 1$ events among them are mutually independent. We characterise all probability measures with respect to which $n$ random events are $(n - 1)$-wise independent. We provide sharp upper and lower bounds on the probability that at least $k$ out of $n$ events with given marginal probabilities occur over these probability measures. The bounds are shown to be computable in polynomial time.
dc:creator: Karthik Natarajan, Arjun Kodagehalli Ramachandra, Colin Tan
